page.title: 02BLYTH RECOLLECTIONS. (1)
page.content: {Interview with Miss and Mrs Oakes.} Miss and Mrs Oakes first recollection of Blyth is,fetching the milk.The first milkman came round with a pint measure. The first milkbottle came in about 1932. Their second recollection is when Lord Barnby was a squire at the hall: when he died about 1929 his coffin went on a farm wagon to the new cemetery and every boy from the school carried a wreath. {Changes in Blyth.} The traffic has changed, wider roads, bigger fields, fewer hedges, fewer wild flowers and the roads are smoother. They used to have tall signposts so that the horsemen could see but now they are low.Electricity came in 1930. Water used to come from wells. Some people got water from the water tower at Blyth hall.
